summary: I obtained my PhD in 2013 from the University of Western Sydney, Australia. My PhD focussed on the maternal vascular implications of pregnancy and the impact of hypertensive disorders upon the maternal vasculature throughout and after pregnancy. I then completed a Medical degree University of Groningen, Netherlands. I am currently a 4th year Internal Medicine Registrar.

education.field_of_study: Cardiovascular physiology throughout pregnancy, Hypertensive Disorders of Pregnancy, Preeclampsia

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS)

awards.title: Three Minute Thesis Winner and People’s Choice (University Level)
awards.description:
The Three Minute Thesis is a research communication competition developed by The University of Queensland which challenges research higher degree students to present a compelling oration on their thesis and its significance in just three minutes in language appropriate to a non-specialist audience.

I won the School of Medicine division, came runner-up and People's Choice in the College (UWS) division, and won the University division of the 3MT. I then represented my University at the National Finals.

awards.title: University of Western Sydney Postgraduate Research Award
awards.description:
These awards are for full-time study towards higher degrees by research. Australian Postgraduate Awards are funded by the Department of Industry, Innovation, Climate Change, Science, Research and Tertiary Education. Competition for the APA scheme is intense; only applicants with a first-class Bachelor Honours degree or equivalent qualifications and experience are offered an award.

I was awarded the Postgraduate Research Award for the duration of my PhD. The scholarship is $24,653 per year.

awards.title: University of Western Sydney Postgraduate Research Award Top Up Award
awards.description:
UWS top-up scholarships of $10,000 per annum are awarded to the highest ranked applicants of the Postgraduate Research Award.

I was awarded the Top Up Award for the duration of my PhD candidature.

awards.title: Ingham Health Research Institute Scholarship
awards.description:
Inghams Enterprises is Australia's largest poultry production company, employing over 8,000 staff and operating in all states of Australia and in New Zealand.  Based in Liverpool, Inghams Enterprises has a long history of supporting locally based charities and community organisations.

The Ingham Health Research Institute (IHRI) was established by the Ingham family in 1996, and has a commitment to medical research and better health services for Liverpool and the South West Sydney region. The Board of the IHRI has the overall responsibility for the successful development and productivity of the Institute.

The Inghams Medical Research Scholarship demonstrates the organisation's commitment to supporting the next generation of medical practitioners and researchers for Western Sydney.

I was awarded this scholarship for the period of my MBBS/BMedRes/PhD candidature. The scholarship is $10,000 per year.

awards.title: Member of the Golden Key International Honour Society
awards.description: Golden Key is the world's leading invitation-only honour society. It recognizes high-achieving students for their commitment to academics—undergraduates for being in the top 15% of their class, and top-performing graduate students. Members connect with others who share their passion for learning, leading to a lifetime of scholarship and achievement.

awards.title: Rural Australian Medical Undergraduate Scholarship
awards.description:
The RAMUS Scheme is funded by the Australian Government and assists selected students with a rural background to study medicine at university. In addition to their rural background, RAMUS scholarship holders are selected on the basis of financial need and demonstrated commitment to working in rural Australia in the future.

The Scheme is aimed at attracting more doctors to rural and remote Australia.

The RAMUS Scheme supports a total of 580 current scholarship holders. Approximately 120 new scholarships are awarded each year through a competitive application round.

The National Rural Health Alliance administers the RAMUS Scheme on behalf of the Department of Health and Ageing.

I was awarded the RAMUS for the duration of my Medical degree.
awards.issuer: National Rural Health Alliance, Department of Health and Ageing, Australian Federal Governement

projects.title: Data paper: Retinal microvascular calibre and blood pressure changes precede the clinical onset of preeclampsia
projects.description: Preeclampsia is a leading cause of maternal morbidity and mortality. The degree of maternal cardiovascular dysfunction that precedes the onset of preeclampsia is largely unknown. This prospective cohort study aimed to characterize differences in vivo in retinal microvascular caliber and blood pressure throughout pregnancy in relation to preeclampsia development. Women were recruited from Royal Prince Alfred Hospital, Sydney, Australia, of which 92 women were included in the study. Retinal images and blood pressures were collected at 13, 19, 29, and 38 weeks of gestation. Retinal vessels were analyzed as the central retinal arteriolar equivalent corrected for mean arterial blood pressure and the central retinal venular equivalent corrected for mean arterial blood pressure, using generalized linear models adjusted for age and body mass index. The preeclampsia group were significantly older (P=0.002) and had a significantly higher mean body mass index (P=0.005). The central retinal arteriolar equivalent corrected for mean arterial blood pressure was significantly reduced at 13 (P=0.03), 19 (P=0.007), and 38 (P=0.03) weeks of gestation in the preeclampsia group. The central retinal venular equivalent corrected for mean arterial blood pressure was also significantly lower at 13 (P=0.04) and 19 (P=0.001) weeks of gestation in the women who progressed to preeclampsia. This study directly documents increased peripheral resistance in vivo, observed as the combination of constricted retinal arterioles or venules and elevated blood pressure, in women who later developed preeclampsia. This difference preceded the clinical signs of preeclampsia.

profile_positions.description: I during my time with Scribbr, a Dutch company based in Amsterdam, I edited more than two million words as a native-English editor. I proofread, edited and analysed the structure of documents such as theses and scientific reports from non-native speaking bachelor, master and doctoral students. When I resigned from Scribbr, I had a client rating of 4.9/5.0, indicating a high degree of satisfaction with my work.
profile_positions.title: Editor

profile_positions.description: This study investigated alterations which occur to the maternal microvasculature during healthy pregnancy and in pregnancy complicated by hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP). Direct, in vivo visualisation of the microvasculature was performed using retinal imaging. Differences in retinal arteriolar calibre and angiogenic biomarker concentration were identified between the two groups; differences occurred before the appearance of overt signs of HDP. Retinal arteriolar and venular calibres in healthy pregnancy were correlated with body mass index. The long term effects of pregnancy and lactation on maternal remote hypertension were also investigated; lactation was found to modify the risk of hypertension development.
profile_positions.title: Doctorate

profile_positions.description: As a PBL tutor I have been able to assist medical students to develop logical reasoning abilities, their abilities in differential diagnosis, the ability to understand the physiological basis of disease, as well as the skills of working professionally and in a team. In this position I was voted the best tutor by the students eight semesters in a row.
profile_positions.title: Problem Based Learning Tutor

profile_positions.description: In this position I created an EndNote database of papers related to Dengue and Climate Change, and then located these papers using various medical databases such as PubMed and MedLine.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant, Epidemiology and Public Health

profile_positions.description: In this internship I performed a search of the literature, analysed and synthesising this knowledge into a literature review, entitled ‘Measuring perinatal mental health risk’, published in 2012 in Annals of Women’s Mental Health (see complete reference below).
profile_positions.title: Measuring perinatal mental health risk

profile_positions.description: In this position I performed venepuncture, set up and collected ECGs, took skin scrapings and nasal and pharyngeal swabs. I developed skills in accuracy, detailed record keeping and time management. As a senior collector I assisted in training new staff.
profile_positions.title: Pathology Collector/Phlebotomist
